channel.title: My Room/Workspace
channel.description:
This is my first real model. It is, of course, is a work in progress and I'll be adding more and more where I can and when I can. It turned out much nicer than expected. 2 hours modeling, 1 hour making/finding textures and materials and about 1 hour for all of these to render.
[b]TODO[/b]
[ul][li][s]Put a nice carpet texture on the floor[/s][/li] [li]Put a lick of paint on the walls, maybe a few decorations[/li] [li]Include lots more detail in to the model[/li] [li]Decorate the room generally[/li] [li]Create a whole room[/li] [li]Sort out the lighting[/li] [li]Maybe add a few windows/more objects[/li] [li]Add much more detail to the computer. It seems very bare at the moment, mainly because the base is the same colour as the case.[/li][/ul]
[u][b]CC, advice, tips suggestions will be absolutely adored <3[/b][/u]
If you want to see the wireframe (Very boring) please ask :)
[b]Update[/b] Added a sofa, a computer chair and a coffee table. Some of the materials and textures on some of them need to be sorted out, but the models seem ok. I also arranged it to look more room-like. There are only two pictures because it looks a bit odd as is. Once the room's completely finished I'll post some good angles. For now, Ill leave this project for a bit and start focusing on smaller models of single objects. Making them look as real as possible :) I'll post them in this forum, as well as others.
[URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img517.imageshack.us/img517/4421/workspace1op6.png[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img266.imageshack.us/img266/1039/workspace2pr3.png[/img][/URL]
So, expect to see some more single C4D models from me in the very, very near future :)
Enjoy...hopefully.

item.description:

Goes Into Shock…Stops Shock… O,M,G! These Are The Best Pics Ever!!!

Thanks, but they’re really not <3

I was going to start a full interior scene this weekend, because I learnt some really great techniques for box modeling, but I’m tied down with coursework for school :
[/quote]What’re you talking about i can’t even do one bit of this not even the glass lol[/quote]

Do you even have glass textures?

And if you cant do the glass… This is not for you…

All-in-all, it looks amazing.[/quote]

TY for the comments. I don’t actually know. I should really hang some hinges down from the bottom and make it slide-able

item.title: My Room/Workspace
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:24, topic:104869”][quote author=FastBawlz link=topic=150010.msg1431888#msg1431888 date=1180989903]

Erm, wtf has that got to do with anything?

A good leather texture would be pretty near impossible to make without an image.

, Btw can you post the .C4D for LR :|?

Wtf, fastbawlz. You’ve just proved my point. You can’t make a realistic leather texture without an image of the texture, which that isn’t. You also couldn’t get a one coloured one from that.

No I wont post the C4D. You wont learn anything from me posting the C4D.

Actually “one” can learn to rip.

But actually you could learn what techniques you did on how you modeled it, anyway…

Btw are you calling me a Ripper?
[/quote]

You wouldn’t be able to see the techniques on the C4D.

Calling me a ripper goatee?[/quote]

You kinda would?

Anyway I’m to busy playing around with the text and putting effects on it anyway

Read full topic
